resources.string: Isn’t it a lovely day? Well, lovely for Weaver's Fen. If you need any ingredients, you can always get them at the Trading Post. \n\nIf you’re looking for fibres, Maria Sancho can point you in the right direction.
Desire For A Child
Primrose has asked you to find her darling daughter, Hazel. Your search starts at her childhood home in Hakenstadt.

Gentle stranger, could you help an old woman? I fear my daughter could be in danger. \n\nOh. Who am I fooling? She's definitely in danger. I mean, it's Aeternum! And she'd surely have missed me by now.
"Where would she most likely go?"

Hakenstadt. It's where Hazel grew up, where she said "mama" for the first time. Have you ever experienced a child's first word? It's utterly delightful! \n\nPlease, find my baby girl and bring her back to me.
Any word on my Hazel? She's a tall, smiling brunette with dancing eyes. \n\nAlways happy, no matter what challenge comes her way.
What did you find in Hakenstadt? I miss that place. \n\nMy husband and I taught Hazel to sew there. She loved making little dresses for her dolls.
"I found her notes."
What?! Surely, Hazel couldn't have written these notes. \n\nWhy would my daughter dabble in life magic? She knows nothing of such things. Magic on this island can be dangerous!
Search for Hazel in {POITags}
Dispel the remnants of Hazel's experiment
Collect Hazel's Note
The Truth Behind Transmutations
Hazel has been experimenting with forbidden life magic. Continue your search further east in Krummholm.
Oh goodness! Hazel, what were you doing? She knows such magics are forbidden in the Fen! \n\nWhy would my baby do something so risky? I didn't even know she wanted a child.
"Why would Hazel want a child?"

My poor girl! I knew she longed to experience motherhood. I'd speak often of the joy I felt carrying her, feeling her grow inside me. \n\nSeeing her excitement as she experienced this mysterious new world was an indescribable joy.
"Hazel was born here?"

Yes, a few months after we arrived. Little Hazel brought such happiness to me and my husband. When Corruption tragically claimed him, Hazel saved me from falling to despair. \n\nPlease find my daughter and bring her back to me!
Any news on my Hazel? I've been worried sick. \n\nI couldn't bear losing her as well. She's the sunshine of my soul.
You're back! What news of Hazel? \n\nWait. What do you mean she wasn't at Krummholm?
Search for Hazel in {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from {targetName}
Destroy jars
Collect Hazel's Note
The Hope Of The Living
Primrose fears what her daughter may have done. Find Hazel and bring her safely back home.
Binding animal parts together? That sounds like something the Crone would do! \n\nOh, Hazel... I never asked for a grandchild. Why'd she think I wanted one?
"She was clearly affected by your stories."
I only sought to comfort her. And she knows this island can be cruel. I love my Hazel, the woman she's become. She's brave and beautiful. \n\nPlease find her. Say her mother misses her terribly.
Please find Hazel and tell her to come back home. \n\nTell her the two of us are enough. We have to be.
No! Hazel! Why did you do this to yourself? This is my fault… I drove her to this… \n\nI'm sorry, you did all you could, stranger. Leave this old woman to her tears...
Search for Hazel in {POITags}
Collect Hazel's Note
Defeat Hazel to free her from her torment
I don't know how I will go on without my Hazel... \n\nThis island will never be satisfied until it has taken everything from you…

Isn’t the Fen the prettiest place you’ve ever been? It’s home to so much life, in the waters, in the trees, in the air. \n\nThe earth used to be happy once. You should have seen her in her glory days. Before the Great Shattering.
"What was the Shattering?"

A time of much sorrow, when the world was trampled by the Lost. \n\nThe Corpse Crone still haunts the southwestern fen. Don’t bother with the silkweed there. You’ll be better off gathering hemp from the western fields.
Now that you've been around, surely you agree how gorgeous the fens are. The wildlife! The fresh air! \n\nYou should have seen her in her glory days. Before the Great Shattering.
Ever talked to a man you fancied and he opens his mouth and the fancy evaporates? \n\nAnd you want to travel back in time to the moment before he spoke, but you can’t?
"Maybe you haven’t met the right man?"

After 500 years, you gotta face the possibility that there may be no such thing. There are plenty of oversized children, loudmouthed braggarts, and the eternally confused, however. \n\nTake home a candle instead. It's warmth, no drama.
Did you run out of candles? Sadly, I'm all out too. \n\nIsn't that just the thing. Can't find a decent man, or a steady supply of warmth. Perhaps it's time to invest in a hearty blanket.
Felt the strange heat in the fog? It clings to your skin like a wet sock. Could have you feeling clammy. \n\nStrange dreams? Chills at night? It could be the swamp sickness, my friend.
"Is it serious?"
Yes, very. Catch it and you’ll turn Lost in a week. Luckily, I have found a cure. \n\nTheuderic Julietti at your service! For only 100 coin, I’ll sneak you the right card in this game of life.
Ah, I see you cannot resist my cures after all. \n\nAt 100 coins, they are a steal, and will keep you safe from any lingering swamp sickness.

Hah, watch yourself. You don’t want to mess with a reptile her size. She’s a bit grumpy today. And her teeth can cut through iron. Chomp chomp. \n\nI understand the old girl. I’d be cranky too if I had an aching belly. You know
"Did she eat something bad?"

Haha, this darling should stick to rabbits. But she's got a taste for humans. Imagine someone chasing you for your skin. \n\nThe poor darling probably gets scared. She just shouldn't eat me again, silly girl.
"Why do you stay with her?"
How could I not? She’s adorable. Look how she waddles into the river. \n\nShe needs me. If I don’t protect her, who will?
Look at that, she remembers you! \n\nOh, you probably can't sense any changes, but I noticed a slight spring in her crocodilian steps.
Hey, mind you don’t make too much noise, even on the road. \n\nYou never know what might come running out of the murk.
Denying The Denier
Travel to Periville, slay the Denier, and bring proof of its demise to Evelyn Van Heck in Weaver's Fen.
It’s quiet out there. Far too quiet.\n\nI fear the worst for my companions. They should have arisen by now. Have you perchance seen anyone in attire like mine along the road?
"I am afraid I haven’t.”

I expected as much. Blast.\n\nMy companions and I are shadow hunters. We formed a band called the White Skulls to hunt the Corpse Crone and her many abominations. We were chasing such a monster when my companions and I were slain.
“What killed you?”

A brute known as The Denier. He's easily twice my height and thick as a bull! \n\nI would not dare face him again alone, but there is a bounty to collect if you are brave enough to bring back proof of his demise. Interested?
Just so we're clear, I am not responsible if The Denier kills you as well. \n\nYou take on this bounty at your own risk. I am content to wait here for my company to return.
He was once our brother. Alas, this terrible fate so often awaits the Crone's many victims. \n\nHere. Your bounty, as promised.
Slay The Denier at Periville
Defeat {targetName} and bring its {itemName} to Evelyn Van Heck
Keeping the Faith
Travel to Periville and find Joan and Markus. Report back to Evelyn Van Heck in Weaver's Fen with news of their fate.
If you bested The Denier, then perhaps you can be of further use. \n\nMy comrades and I chose this as a meeting point in the event our hunt was unsuccessful. They still haven't returned...
“What do you think happened to them?”
Unfortunately, I must assume the worst. Joan and Markus had only recently joined our hunt. It's possible they lacked the fortitude to withstand such a harrowing death. \n\nCall me sentimental, but…
“You still care about them.”

Blood and toil have a way of bonding people. Search Periville for any sign of their resurrection or… unfortunate demise. \n\nReturn them to me, if you can. And if the worst has happened, reclaim their White Skull Bands for me.
Hope for the best, prepare for… well, I would rather not think about that.
I am at a loss for words, traveler. \n\nThis emblem was a bond of brotherhood. It is a symbol of our commitment to the hunt.
Search for Joan and Markus in Periville
Search for Joan
Defeat {targetName} and reclaim her {itemName}
Search for Markus
Defeat {targetName} and reclaim his {itemName}
A Well-Earned Respite
Travel to Karburg, slay Ruiz Velazquez, and bring proof of his demise to Evelyn Van Heck in Weaver's Fen.
Well, this is grim, isn’t it? Am I the only one left? \n\nNo. Ruiz founded the White Skulls. He was a shadow hunter of unshakeable resolve. He would not leave me like this…
“Do you want me to find him, too?”
You have already risked so much. It pains me to ask for your aid again. \n\nFor what's it worth, I know where to find him: at the site of his most grim demise.
“Where might that be?”

Karburg. It was there he sought to pass judgment over the Crone herself. And paid for it with his life. \n\nWithout hope, only horror remains. When you enter the town square, you'll know where to find him.
I pray I am wrong. I do not think I am, but I must cling to hope. \n\nToo much despair and we lose ourselves. Just like they did.

Am I truly all that remains? Ruiz and I had such plans. We intended to hunt terrors in the shadow lands of Durevos. \n\nHow cruel is fate, that I should live to see him become a monster like those we fought so hard to destroy?
“Are you going to be alright?”

Time will tell, traveler. They found their final death. And yet I survive. \n\nI will never forget what you did today. I'll try to rebuild the White Skulls to carry on in their memory. Take care, friend.
Return Ruiz to his rest in Karburg
Defeat {targetName} and claim his {itemName}
I will remain vigilant. I will not lose faith, nor hope, nor conviction. \n\nDespite the fact that I carry on the hunt alone. For now at least…
Just look at this incredible stonework! Can't you just feel the weight of the years, pressing down?
Story of the Stones
Gather stone samples from rubble in the nearby ruins. Then report back to Architect Na Li in Weaver's Fen.

Oh, hello! Perfect timing! I'm Na Li, the architect. You've probably seen my work in the Ebonscale settlement.\n\nSay, do me a favor. Take a look at this bridge, and tell me: how old do you think it is?
"Really old, probably?"

Yes, exactly! These stones have been here as long as anyone can remember. If we can learn how the Ancient architects reinforced these structures, imagine what WE could accomplish!\n\nSo, I have a theory!
"What's your theory?"
If my assessment is correct, this bridge is over ten THOUSAND years old! I simply must get my hands on some samples to prove it.\n\nCould you help me with that?
Do you have those stone samples for me? They are vital to my research.
Look at this beautiful basalt you’ve brought me. I wonder where the Ancients sourced it from?\n\nNow, let’s see about that aging… huh. Wait…that can’t be right.
Gather {itemName} from Rubble
Spanning the Ages
Gather stone samples from rubble at South Vega Bridge. Then report back to Architect Na Li in Weaver's Fen.

Well, this is puzzling. Judging by the level of erosion, sediment layers, and my chemical analysis… these stones could be several orders of magnitude older than I first guessed. \n\nIt defies the imagination.
"How old, exactly?"

I need another sample from a newer site to be certain. Master Ting Long once theorized that the bridge that spans the marshes was built in a more recent era. \n\nCould you bring me samples from South Vega Bridge for comparison?
I hope to have answers for us soon, my friend. \n\nAnd if I am right, then we might see some NEW wonders in Aeternum.
Great, you’re back. Let’s take a look at these new samples you've found.\n\nInteresting… these are less weathered, but only just. Fascinating.
Gather stone samples from South Vega Bridge
Gather {itemName} from Rubble
Deep Time
Gather stone samples from rubble at Andrometus. Then report back to Architect Na Li in Weaver's Fen.
I will not allow myself to grow too excited just yet. \n\nBut if my observations are correct, this stone is many hundreds of thousands, perhaps even MILLIONS of years old. Think of the implications!
"Wouldn't that mean the Ancients are also that old?”

It does, doesn’t it? So many questions, but we must resist the temptation to draw conclusions. Stone dating is far from an established field of study, after all.\n\nRegardless, I am looking toward the future, today.
"You want to build something that will last.”

Yes. I do. While I respect Master Ting Long’s work, I can see beyond it.\n\nThere is one structure here that predates all the others, according to my mentor’s study. Can you visit Andrometus and collect samples for me there?
Let me know when you've got those Andrometus samples. \n\nI have some theories about how they accomplished these feats of longevity, but I never draw conclusions without proof.

You and I will be friends, after this. Perhaps I will carve your name into the aqueducts of the future. Or would you prefer a temple? Maybe a stone garden?\n\nI am certain I can extract their secrets, thanks to you.
“How old was that last sample?”

Old. Impossibly old. Old enough that I am questioning my methods, but since you asked… somewhere in the realm of twelve million years.\n\nInsanity, I know. Perhaps I will send you a letter when I can confirm my findings.
Gather stone samples from Andrometus
Gather {itemName} from Rubble
The future is bright, and I am going to be the one to build it.
If you happen to spot a woman hiding in some absurd corner of a ruin, do let her know she has won and the game is over. Thank you!
Shh! Find your own hiding spot, will you?
Misplaced Treasure
Search chests at North Vega Bridge for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts. Then report back to Leonie Roggeveen in Weaver's Fen.

Finally, a traveler along the road!\n\nI’m Dr. Leonie Roggeveen. My wife Nora and I – we work as a team – we’re here to see what we could dig up in these ruins. To study. We’re antiquarians– numismatists– scholars, you see.
“{playerName}. Pleased to meet you.”

Likewise. I was wondering if you might be able to help me? \n\nYou see, Nora and I like to play a little game to pass the time. She hides herself and leaves clues for me to find amongst these relics. Brain teasers, and the like.
"Do you need help with a clue?”

Yes! But not how you imagine.\n\nI was looking for her latest clue at North Vega bridge when something awoke the Guardians. I don’t fight. Could you find the clue and bring it back to me? Check inside the coffers and chests.
This game was much less stressful when it took place in EMPTY ruins, you see. I do hope she's alright.
You’re back! And in one piece! Do you have the clue? It could be a coin, a note, an etching…\n\nOh, give it here. The suspense is killing me.
"I found this coin."
A coin!! Oh, I just love solving her puzzles. Though it is markedly less stressful when she is not potentially hurt or in danger. \n\nAll the same… let’s see what the coin has to say…
Search chests at North Vega Bridge for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts
Search chests for Nora’s clue
Following Nora
Search chests at Canopus for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts. Then report back to Leonie Roggeveen in Weaver's Fen.
Hmm, yeah, that blue-ish hue means starmetal… and the three-faced queen on the obverse…there’s no doubt about it. This coin came from the Canopus dig site! \n\nBut wait! Huh, that’s strange…
"What’s strange?”

Something about the iconography she used… It suggests half of a whole. Aha!\n\nShe means to have me combine two clues to find her, but this tells me the second clue is at Canopus. Very clever. Care to help again?
As thrilled as I am, her long absence is truly starting to wear on me. Could you hurry with that clue? \n\nIt would put me at ease to finally find her.
Another coin! Wonderful, hand it over, let’s see what she has to say…
Search chests at Canopus for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts
Search chests for Nora’s clue
Odds in Her Favor
Follow Nora's trail to Aqua Acadia and search chests for the final clue.
Ahem! Okay, let’s see what we’ve got here. Hmm… If I turn it this way and hold it against the other coin… Some sort of bridge? Nein… An aquedu-- Aha! \n\nI’ve got it! It came from Aqua Acadia!
"Nice job."
Nora thought she could stump me, did she? Me, the greatest coin collector in Aeternum? \n\nCome on, give me a tough one, ha!
"Seems like you have this figured out."

I do! But Nora might be dead. That makes this less fun.\n\nAqua Acadia is crawling with some truly nasty Ancient Guardians. Last time we were there, we had an armed guard of twenty soldiers…but you’re super strong, right?
Hopefully we near the end of our chase, my friend. Nora can handle herself… right?
I see you found my note. Did Dr. Leonie send you?
"I'm {playerName}. Are you Nora?"
Yes, I'm Leonie's wife! I am so pleased she solved it. \n\nThank goodness she had the sense to send someone like you, though, these Ancient Guardians are not ordinarily part of our game.
Follow Nora's trail to Aqua Acadia
Search chests for the final clue
Nora, Found
Return to Dr. Leonie Roggeveen in Weaver's Fen.
I knew Leonie wouldn't be able to resist another puzzle. Be honest, she's loving this, right? \n\nShe’s not too worried?
"She seems a little stressed, yes.”
Yeah, no wonder. When those Guardians appeared, the only two things I could think about were "I'm going to die" and "Leonie will be so worried".
"So you’ve been stuck here?"

I was, fortunately, already well in hiding when the Guardians started swarming the place. Thank goodness you came along! I was starting to get hungry.\n\nAnyway, let’s head back. I’m eager to see Leonie after this.
I'll meet you and Leonie back on the road. I'll sneak out while you're distracting them.

You’re back! Nora told me everything. I am SO relieved.\n\nI’m going to have a talk with her about taking some precautions next time. But this was a fine game, and you were an enormous help. Thank you!
Have you found any more clues? Or, uh, my wife?
That was fun. In hindsight, the added threat of bodily harm did make it more thrilling. \n\nI am just glad she is back with me.
She must be so worried about me…
I think our next game will feature less… excitement. Ah, well, lesson learned.
I think our next game will feature less… excitement. Ah, well, lesson learned.
Return to Dr. Leonie Roggeveen
Alright, Torchy, stay cool. Everything is going to be fine. \n\nOh… could you come back a bit later?
Starting the Fire
Gather strange torches from Richmire region and bring them to Torchy Cabrera in Weaver's Fen.
Well met, traveler! People call me Torchy, on account of my… interests.\n\nYou have my word, however. Despite what they say, I swear, I am not a threat to society.
"What is it that they say?"

Ah well, if you have not heard anything, then perhaps it is best we keep it that way.\n\nSuffice to say that I am no longer welcome in the Restless Shore settlement. It's really because of my research.
"Let me guess - you research fire?"

I do. I am on a quest to discover a way to create an "Eternal Flame!" Perhaps you would help me? \n\nScattered around Richmire there are strange, long-burning torches. Get some of these for me, and I will reward you.
Be on the lookout for the strange, ghostly torches. And try not to get burned too badly.
Oh, yes. Don't you see? The light, the color… it is truly beautiful. \n\nI will study these and see if I might discover how they burn so long and so bright.
Gather torches from {POITags}
Defeat Revenants to get {itemName}
Burning from the Inside
Collect Perpetual Illumination Essences from Ancients at Aqua Acadia and bring them to Torchy Cabrera in Weaver's Fen.
You seem to be a bright light yourself, my friend. These torches cannot have been easy to acquire. \n\nI wonder, though, if you might humor Torchy for one more favor, eh?
"Depends. What's the favor?"
I believe the Ancients knew the secrets of Eternal Fire and Eternal Light as well. \n\nHave you ever noticed the perpetual glow that clings to the walking corpses of the Ancient Guardians?
"Now that you mention it, yes."

Indeed, they are imbued with some luminous magic, and in the ruins nearby, the bones glow even more than usual. \n\nYes. Aqua Acadia to the north. Gather some of the Guardians' essence, then we will know.
Amid the ruins of Aqua Acadia to the north, you will see for yourself. \n\nThe Guardians there glow more than anywhere else. Gather their essence, my friend.
Perfect… perfect! This illumination essence is the missing link! \n\nCombined with the substance in the torches from Karburg, I feel certain we have found the secret!
Collect Perpetual Illumination Essences from Aqua Acadia
Collect {itemName} from Ancient Guardian
Hellfire & Brimstone Oven
Travel to Navarro's Kitchen and defeat Chef Navarro and collect "Navarro's Flaming Duck Recipe". Then bring it to Torchy in Weaver's Fen.

Yes, my friend. With what you acquired, Eternal Flame is finally within our reach! \n\nI just need to get back to my hovel in Restless Shore. So, maybe one more favor for Torchy? This time, it is a righteous one!
"What do you mean by that?"
You must help me clear my name so I can go home. You see, I was exiled from the settlement for starting a fire… \n\nBut for once, it was NOT me who ignited the flame. I was framed, you see!
"Framed by whom?"

By that greedy bastard, Chef Navarro! He was trying out his new "Flaming Duck" recipe and burned down half the settlement! \n\nHe became Corrupted, of course, but his "Kitchen" is nearby. Defeat him and get that recipe as proof of his guilt!
Chef Navarro's Kitchen is not far, and I feel certain he still carries his "Flaming Duck Recipe." \n\nDefeat the bastard and get the recipe and I can finally clear my name.
He still had it, didn't he? Yes… yes! This proves that HE was the one who started the fire! \n\nThank you, my friend! I cannot thank you enough for helping me get back home.
"What about the 'Eternal Flame'?"
Oh, believe me! We will have that burning in no time! With everything you acquired and the black powder in my hovel, we will show them all a REAL FIRE! \n\nI mean... the good kind, of course.
Defeat Chef Navarro for "Navarro's Flaming Duck Recipe" at Navarro's Kitchen
Defeat {targetName} and Collect {itemName}
Once I am back in Restless Shore, I will create the world's first Eternal Flame! \n\nI will light it in your honor, my friend. We will set the world on FIRE!
Greetings, denizen of this fine, fetid land. Tis I! Samuel Worthington Bloodgood the Third, hunter extraordinaire, at your service!
Gators Gone Wild
Collect alligator scales from Gators in Weaver's Fen and return them to Hunter Samuel in Weaver's Fen.
Oh, you must be the hardy sort, to wander so freely in a place like this! I dare say you might even be capable with that weapon of yours. \n\nWhat say you to a friendly competition?
“What did you have in mind?”

A hunt, of course! You and I shall venture forth into the marshes in pursuit of the most ferocious, cunning, and formidable beasts this festering land has to offer! \n\nJust as my forebears have done since time immemorial!
“I’m game. Where do we start?”

Aha! Excellent! To begin, we will make trophies of the largest predators these foul marshes have to offer! \n\nBring me the hides of any Gators you find in the Fen. And as I have said many times: Let the hunt begin!
I shall make my own way into the stinking bog. \n\nYou go on ahead. I suspect you will need the head start, after all.

Ah, you have returned! I was beginning to wonder. Now, let me see your trophies. \n\nYes... thick, unblemished, and as hard as anything. These are certifiably the remains of several fine beasts. Well done!
“So, do I win?”

Ah… well, you see, I was waylaid almost the moment you departed. A lone damsel walked the roads alone and I simply had to escort her to the hamlet. You would understand. \n\nAll the same, I am TERRIBLY impressed.
Defeat Gators to Collect {itemName} in Weaver's Fen
No Mere Pigs
Collect boar tusks from Polder Boars in Weaver's Fen and return them to Hunter Samuel just south of the settlement.
It would be so terribly unfair of me to deprive you of another contest, since I so RUDELY abandoned my own attempt. \n\nShall we have another?
“What are we hunting now?”

Boars! No ordinary boars, but boars the size of three men! We will not waste our skill on mere pigs! \n\nBring me the largest tusks you can find, and we shall compare trophies. They're a plague to this region!
Ah, yes, I shall be along promptly! \n\nUh, once I have finished oiling my musket, of course.
The prodigal hunter returns! You truly are a fellow after my own heart. \n\nLet us see your fine trophies. Hand them over, I say!
“You first.”

Ah! Naturally! Let me see… I had the tusks just here, in my satchel. \n\nOH! IMPOSSIBLE! Look at this! Their sheer size and sharpness must have punctured a hole in my bag. Alas, I fear this contest is a draw once more!
Defeat Polder Boars to collect {itemName}s in Weaver's Fen
The True Contest
Collect wolf paws from Mallory Wolves, found north of Fenton's Hamlet, and return them to Hunter Samuel in Weaver's Fen.

I am becoming increasingly eager to prove myself to you, my friend. \n\nTo know you have toiled so hard in these blighted lands, and myself empty-handed! Why, it is hardly befitting of a Bloodgood, let alone the third.
“Does that mean I won?”
How can you have won if there has been no contest? \n\nNay, we shall have to settle this once and for all.
“I don’t know…”
Do you doubt me? ME?! Samuel Worthington Bloodgood THE THIRD?! \n\nNow this is a matter of honor. I demand satisfaction!
“That’s not—"
My word is my BOND, stranger. If I say I shall hunt, then I shall HUNT! \n\nIs it not my name, my legacy, my REPUTATION that demands that we should finish this contest? Do you know nothing of honor?!
“Fine! What are 'we' hunting this time?”

Haha! You ARE a noble soul, after all. Let us hunt! \n\nTo the north you will find a pack of wolves known for their size and cunning. Claim their paws, and we shall compare to see who killed the greatest beast.
I relish the end of our contest. Go on. I am right behind you!

You are simply not going to believe this. My musket was ready, my boots laced, my satchel patched, and a COURIER found me on the road! There was urgent business in the hamlet to attend to. \n\nAlas, I must concede.
“Somehow I don’t believe you.”

Hmm, I understand, and I do not blame you. One excuse, understandable. Two! Difficult, but you gave me the benefit of your doubt. But this? Reprehensible. \n\nPlease, accept this reward by way of apology.
Defeat Mallory Wolves to Collect {itemName}s in Weaver's Fen
Stalk of Shame
Defeat the Werna Packleader at Dusty Paw Burrow, far to the north and west of Weaver’s Fen Hamlet, and collect a trophy from your kill for Hunter Samuel in Weaver's Fen.
I understand I am stretching the bounds of your credulity right now. Truly, I do. \n\nUh, yes, I, uh, I have… a confession to make, if you will hear it.
“I’m listening.”
Do you know what it's like, being saddled with a legacy like mine? Why, if people only knew how incompetent I really am, my family name would be utterly ruined. \n\nThat is why I need your help.
“I’m invested, at this point.”

Well, the hamlet here demanded my aid. A large white wolf called Werna and her pack have been wreaking havoc on travelers wandering the northern roads. \n\nIf you can kill her and bring me proof, I shall give you the bounty.
I will not pretend that this arrangement pleases me, my friend, but I am grateful that you have chosen to take pity on me.
Ah, well, there it is. She was enormous, wasn’t she? I, uh, I wish I could have seen it myself. \n\nAs promised, here is your bounty. And a tip. Your… continuing discretion is appreciated.
Track down the Werna Packleader at Dusty Paw Burrow
Defeat the Werna Packleader to Collect {itemName}

Well, I believe retirement is in my future. A quiet, obscure, shameless retirement where no one need witness my forebear’s disappointment. \n\nI should thank you, but I would rather we did not meet again.
The stench of this swamp… it's so beautiful.
That Beautiful Stench
Gather materials in Weaver's Fen and then visit an arcane repository to craft a perfume for Tullius Volusus in Weaver's Fen.
Stop for a moment, friend. Take a deep breath. Yes, drink it in. What does the Fen smell like to you?
"It smells like a swamp."
Yes, precisely! \n\nThat scent, it is primal, inescapable. It reaches down through your nose, through your lungs, into your very soul. With every breath, it commands, "Be awake! Be alive!”
"It is certainly hard to ignore."

So? How much of life you miss, if you seek only inoffensive things. \n\nPlease, I must capture this fragrance. Bring me the aromas of the Fen, brew them and bottle them, and I’ll reward you handsomely, hmm?
Can the unique fragrance of Weaver’s Fen truly be replicated by human hands? I await your return with bated breath.

Hmm, yes… decadent, musky, with a sulfuric accord that resonates right through to the top notes… you’ve captured Weaver's Fen perfectly. \n\nYou may be a genius, my friend! Ah, my eyes are watering with emotion!
"The aroma is… surprising!”

Is it so shocking? Hah! If only the ladies of New Corsica knew what they daubed upon their wrists. \n\nThe art of perfume is like life: The whole is larger than the sum of its parts. Thank you for your contributions.
Take {itemName}
Gather {itemName} from Bumbleblossom in northern Weaver’s Fen
Gather {itemName} from stags in northern Weaver’s Fen (Skinning Skill 50 Required)
Gather {itemName} from chests in Fenton Hamlet
Use the Arcane Repository
Craft {itemName} at the Arcane Repository
You can close your eyes against sight, plug your ears against sound… but you can't escape the smell, no.
Some folks are saying that a warm cup of mead is the perfect way to stave off the illness. \n\nI heartily recommend you take precautions.
You shall refer to me as Mistress Bergeron. \n\nI hope you like it as much as I do.
Stand upright and look me in the eye when you address me, Marauder. \n\nNow what is your business?

Stand upright and look me in the eye when you address me, Marauder. 

Now what is your business? 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Turn around, weak one, and return the direction from which you approached.
I am here on official business. I have no time to trifle with you.
Greetings, Gladiator {playerName}. I understand you continue on your path to glory. \n\nAre you now prepared to face the trial to become a Ravager?

Greetings, Gladiator {playerName}. I understand you continue on your path to glory. 

Are you now prepared to face the trial to become a Ravager? 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Hail, fellow warrior! Your presence honors us here in the Fen. \n\nCome, let's not allow your talents to go to waste!

Hail, fellow warrior! Your presence honors us here in the Fen. 

Come, let's not allow your talents to go to waste! 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Why continue to wander alone when the Syndicate offers so much?
Ah, excuse me, I was lost in thought. How might the Syndicate serve you?
Ah, excuse me, I was lost in thought. How might the Syndicate serve you? \n\n[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
You may be surprised to know that la famille Rubis has a lineage of great warriors.
To be free to practice the religion of your conscience without persecution. It was different back en France.
Some find the smell of the swamp offensive, but I find it quite delightful! \n\nAh, but it's you, Scrivener {playerName}! And you are prepared to advance in rank as well?

Some find the smell of the swamp offensive, but I find it quite delightful! 

Ah, but it's you, Scrivener {playerName}! And you are prepared to advance In rank as well? 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
The specimens you gathered are helping me learn a great deal about the Fen. \n\nNow, what else can we do to benefit the Syndicate?

The specimens you gathered are helping me learn a great deal about the Fen. 

Now, what else can we do to benefit the Syndicate? 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Those who are truly blind cannot see even in the light.
If you always give, you will always have. What may I give you, devotee?
If you always give, you will always have. What may I give you, devotee? \n\n[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Arrogance invites ruin. Humility receives benefits.
The bird does not sing because he has the answer. He sings because he has a song.
The Spark shines brightly in the Fen with you here, Templar {playerName}. \n\nAnd it seems you have now proven yourself worthy of further advancement.

The Spark shines brightly in the Fen with you here, Templar {playerName}. 

And it seems you have now proven yourself worthy of further advancement. 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
You are always welcome to fight for justice with us here in Weaver's Fen. \n\nWherever you go, however, may the light of the Spark go with you.

You are always welcome to fight for justice with us here in Weaver's Fen. 

Wherever you go, however, may the light of the Spark go with you. 

[ Level 28 required for Weaver's Fen faction missions ]
Takes a certain kind to travel through the Fen. You best be warned I'll have my eye on you, stranger. \n\nNo matter, make yourself comfortable. Just not too comfortable.
I was skeptical when I first saw you stroll by here - but you've proven me wrong. \n\nWeaver's Fen's in a better place than when you found it. Have you heard about Restless Shore though?
Always good to see a familiar face back here in the Fen. \n\nPeople are still talking about all you did here.
Peace and good day, I am Master Fisher Agarwal. I know this Fen's fish better than anyone.
Peace and good day, I am Master Fisher Agarwal. I know this Fen's fish better than anyone.
Fish all you like in Aeternum, for the rivers and seas will never run barren!
The Nose Knows
Find someone who can make bear repellent, as a favor to Dr. Theophrastus. Then, distribute the repellent to the researchers in the field.
Locate someone who can teach you more about Bear Repellent
Gather ingredients to craft bear repellant from Ursus Hortus
Craft {itemName} at Julio's Campfire
Provide Bear Repellent to Researcher Piper
Provide Bear Repellent to Researcher Ling
Provide Bear Repellent to Researcher Rinde
Provide Bear Repellent to Researcher Lubin
Return to Dr. Theophrastus
Can't talk yet. Must monitor the experiment, very volatile.\n\nMust watch the condensation…mustn't talk… mustn't... sleep…
"I'm in the Syndicate, too."
Wunderbar! A fellow seeker of truth! In my opinion, the Syndicate is the only rational faction choice. \n\nThough, I do wish we could devote more resources to research, and less to warfare…
"I'm not a Syndicate member."

I see. I suppose we must fight. 

It would be quite inconvenient for me to die right now. If you must kill me, could you monitor my experiment until I return? 

Oh, you won't attack? Then there is no problem!

string.comment: leading into "The Nose Knows" if not Syndicate
string.speaker: Dr. Theophrastus
string.name: DrTheo

resources.string: But I don't mean to be rude, just thought you were delivering my alembics.\n\nLet me introduce myself - my parents named me Theophrastus Bombastus. They were otherwise good parents. But you can call me 'Doctor Theo'.

string.comment: leading into "The Nose Knows" if Syndicate
string.speaker: Dr. Theophrastus
string.name: DrTheo

resources.string: But I don't mean to be rude to a fellow Syndicate member, especially.\n\nLet me introduce myself - my parents named me Theophrastus Bombastus. They were otherwise good parents. But you can call me 'Doctor Theo'.
"Nice to meet you. I'm {playerName}."
Hmm, yes, well. This has been a stimulating conversation, but I must get back to work. \n\nWith this news of Corruption spreading southward, I may need to relocate soon.
"You should defend this place."
Hm. I've more a mind to study Corruption, rather than fight it - the way hosts are controlled… it's like a fungus.\n\nBesides, the Syndicate has its hands full fighting the other factions.
"The factions should unite."

Now that… is funny. I do love a good hypothetical, but right now, I need bear repellant for my research team.\n\nI swear this urine should work... but who knows? Indeed, discover the cure for bears, and we'll talk!
The phosphorus in these urine samples is elevated…it even glows in the dark. Fascinating. \n\nBut will it suffice for the repellant? I need an expert.
Oh, you're back? Do you know much about urine? \n\nI can't figure out where I've gone wrong! Not enough sulfur? It certainly smells bad enough already…
"I already made the bear repellent."

And gave it to my team, too? Thank you! 

I didn't think to ask the hunters. Perhaps I underestimated the value of folk wisdom. 

You've done a service for science today. You and I, we should continue this partnership!
With the bear threat eliminated, we can study the physio-botanical aspects of this region further.\n\nI have a theory, you see, about Corruption and the Angry Earth.
Hey there. Always nice to see a friendly face out here. \n\nIf there's anything you need, just ask.
Heard you tromping through the brush from yards out. Thought you were one of those Syndicate clowns.\n\n They scare off the game.
"Do you know how to make bear repellent?"

Bear repellent? Sure, easy enough. There's an old recipe that hunters here have used for ages. Here, take it. \n\nThose Syndicate folk…if you ask me, they're so concerned with being logical they forget to be practical.
Now I can avoid accidentally stepping on those field researchers…because they reek of bear urine.
Hello! I'd love to chat, but the bears might overhear.
"I, uh, have something for you."
Wow, urine! Just what I needed!
"Really?"
My fellows researchers are also in the field, studying these bears.\n\nYou should bring them some repellent, too. Share the pain…I mean, the wealth.
Every time I don't get eaten by a bear, I'll think of you.
Where's Theo with that bear repellent? Did he get distracted again?
"Do you need some bear repellent?"
Did Theo finally figure out the formula? Thank science for that…
"Here, have some bear repellent."
Wow! That's… pungent!\n\n You know who else would love this formula? Rinde. Definitely.
Now I can finally concentrate on my work.
Oh boy, I must have pissed off someone at headquarters to get this assignment.
"Surprise! I made you some bear repellent."
Ugh, this smells terrible. \n\nThe things I do for data...
"You're welcome."
Get some of this to Lubin. She's like to get herself mauled out here.
Thanks for the urine, I guess.
Have you seen any bears? Did they say anything about me?
"I have some bear repellent for you."
Ah, it's almost a shame. I think the bears were about to accept me, maybe.
"Use the repellent. It's for the best."
You're probably right. Maul me twice, shame on me...\n\nGo and tell Theo I'll try it his way, then.
It's probably for the best that the bears and I don't become best friends… \n\nGotta keep a professional distance.
Good day! Resting in Twillen for a bit? \n\nI bet some new missions have come up on the townboard. I like taking a break to check them once in a while. Always something interesting!
Hello, adventurer! Welcome to Twillen. You seem smart. But are you? \n\nIf you can get me some gold from a place that starts with water, then maybe you’ll convince me.
